title: Drawing, "A Moorish Smoking Room", 1856
medium: Brush and watercolor, gouache on white wove paper
signed: Lower left, in brown ink: E de Coulange inv. 1856
inscribed: On reverse: E. Decoulange/ 1856/ superbe aquarelle/ infinie de details/ Salon en 1856/ coll. Zola
provenance: Eugene V. Thaw Collection; Didier Aaron, Inc., New York
description: Inspired by artist-travelers and their evocations of the harem, the smoking room, here a kiosk in the Moorish style, was designed to stimulate the five senses:  sight and touch, through color, tiles, sumptuous upholstery, exotic lanterns, mirrored panels, and patterned marble floors; smell, through the aroma of tobacco; sound, through music or a water fountain; and taste, through exotic delicacies. All combined to  create the mystical environment of the smoking room.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "A Moorish Smoking Room", 1856.
1856. Brush and watercolor, gouache on white wove paper. Thaw Collection. 2007-27-58.
